page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: OUR AREA,WHICH IS IN WEST GLAMORGAN,IS IN THE UPPER PART OF THE VALE OF NEATH AND IS CRADLED ON TWO SIDES BY THE MOUNTAINS CRAIG-Y-LLYN AND HIR-FYNYDD WHICH INFLUENCE OUR WEATHER TO GIVE US ABOVE AVERAGE RAINFALL.OUR AREA HAS BEEN SEVERELY SCARRED BY HEAVY INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITY AND, AS A RESULT, HUGE SLAG TIPS HAVE SPRUNG UP.MUCH OF OUR MOUNTAIN SIDE HAS BEEN TAKEN OVER BY THE FORESTRY BUT THERE IS QUITE A LOT OF NATURAL WOODLAND AND FARMLAND TOO.THE RIVER NEATH,WHICH ORIGINATES IN THE BRECON BEACONS,MEANDERS ITS WAY THROUGH THE VALLEY PROVIDING ENDLESS HOURS OF ENJOYMENT FOR LOCAL ANGLERS. OUR AREA CONSISTS OF THREE SMALL COMMUNITIES,CWMGWRACH,LAMBAND FLAG AND LOWER GLYNNEATH,EACH WITH ITS SEPARATE LIFESTYLE AND INTERESTS..
